page.title: 15PUBS IN THE NEWTOWN AREA
page.content: There are 3 public houses in the grid area but there have been others. The Traveller's Rest remains an unspoilt traditional pub, for nearly 50 years from 1880 the publican was a member of the Crook family, well known locally. Used by 'locals' it has a darts team and sells colds snacks for travellers. Quite the opposite is The Chairmakers which attracts people from a wide area to its restaurant,providing facilities for young families. The Horse & Jockey is a very old building, used both by local people and visitors attracted to its traditional appearance. Has Darts, Chess and Shove Ha'penny Boards but no teams. Each pub has either a one-armed bandit or a Space Invader. The Plough in Soberton Heath closed in the 1950s, and The Royal Oak was in Liberty Road around the turn of the century, said to have been visited by Queen Victoria
